alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 7:30AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Stewart and Webster Counties through 800 AM EDT... At 729 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Benevolence, or 8 miles north of Cuthbert, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Preston, Richland, Weston, Seminole, Charles, Kimbrough, Westville, Brooklyn, Leveretts, Troutman, Sanford, Centerpoint, Dumas, Louvale and Church Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
